newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MAS wants higher domestic fares.
newsitem.headline: MAS wants higher domestic fares.

text.p: National carrier Malaysian Airline System Bhd (MAS) said on Friday that it wants higher domestic air fares.
"Our (domestic) fares are probably the lowest in the world," said Bashir Ahmed, commercial director of MAS during a presentation at an infrastructure conference.
"They are way far too low. Maybe it's not fair to MAS. The government should be more amenable," Bashir said.
He said the airline has not formally asked the government for a boost in its domestic air fares. MAS last raised its domestic fares by between 10 to 15 percent in 1992.

Last month, MAS raised a majority of its international airfares by three percent following government approval. Airlines around the region had implemented similar fare hikes due to rising jet fuel prices.
Bashir said, "We are now reaching the stage when we can break even on our domestic services." He said the breakeven point for its passenger load factor has declined from 68 percent to 66 percent.
